1312213221313221311111212131211231312111.content:
Sam just kept feeding Dean until they were told that they were done eating. Sam was quite surprised, either by how long this was or by how fast he was able to feed Dean, as Dean was about twice as big as he was, all of it being extra food sitting in his belly. Dean belched loudly as Sam floated around him, seeing how gargantuan Dean truly was. He saw the nubs of fat where Dean's limbs were at the top of his body, showing just how massive his belly was underneath. Sam even pressed himself against Dean's belly, feeling how firm it was on the inside.

Regardless, after this inspection, Eddie said, "My, my, aren't you a generous brother, using your powers to feed your brother as much as he likes." and Dean said, "You mean you haven't been eating as much as me, Sam?" and Sam said, "Yep! I'm saving most of it for you!" and Dean said, "Thanks bro, you're the best!" Sam was glad to at least provide a silver lining to this whole thing by making his brother happy.

Getting out the double doors was another thing. The mess hall had high ceilings and was massive, so it was hard to tell how big they were until they got to the doors. Sam was able to squeeze through using his powers, but he had bent the frames in the process. Eddie said, "How are you going to solve this problem, Sam?" and Sam thought about it before he grabbed a large tree, pulling it out by its roots and bashing it through one of the walls of the mess hall. He continued to widen the hole until it was big enough for Dean, then he pulled Dean through. Eddie then said, "Alright, follow me, Sam!", as the wall quickly repaired itself, and the tree rerooted itself.

"We are here to ride the river!" Eddie said.

"But we are too big for..." Sam tried to explain.

"Don't worry, you two will float down the river!" Eddie said as he rolled Dean into the river, where he floated and stopped at a gate where it was to prevent Dean from continuing down the river. "You two will float down the river and as your counselor, I'll be in a raft following you two."

"Alright," Sam said as he got into the river and floated next to his bother.

"Well this camp is set up to help people relax," Eddie replied.

"Relax?" Dean replied, "How does fattening people and making them young relaxing?"

"But why?" Sam asked this time.

"People deal with stress everyday, we want to take the load off their shoulders and help them out," Eddie explained, "Everyone comes out just fine and more relaxed. We don't harm anyone."
